{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3131198,"name":"sabonn","username":"sabonn","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/f9ae1b/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-21T13:22:24.978Z","cooked":"

I just update my team’s limelight 2 to the latest version and I tried to connect to it by going to the limelight.local:5801 but nothing works. Does someone have any tips on what to do?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-01-21T16:28:55.095Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":895,"reads":125,"readers_count":124,"score":4495.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":424143,"topic_slug":"cant-connect-to-limelight","display_username":"sabonn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55408,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cant-connect-to-limelight/424143/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3131209,"name":"Jeffrey Dunn","username":"TechMaster","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/techmaster/{size}/182893_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-21T14:23:18.543Z","cooked":"

We use the limelight finder tool when looking for our limelight. Once the tool finds the limelight you should be able to select it and click on the configure limelight button. That should get you to the page your looking for.

Downloads – Limelight for FRC (limelightvision.io)

If this tool doesn’t work make sure your limelight has power (by default the blinding green lights should be on) and the ethernet connecting it to the radio/network switch works.

I tried the limelight finder and it didn’t find it, but I was able to get some input by changing the wiring of it (I directly connected the limelight to the roboRIO and ran some code). Still, I can’t connect to the limelight after I updated it.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-01-21T16:26:56.718Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":87.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":424143,"topic_slug":"cant-connect-to-limelight","display_username":"sabonn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":56480,"username":"TechMaster","name":"Jeffrey Dunn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/techmaster/{size}/182893_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55408,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cant-connect-to-limelight/424143/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3131490,"name":"Jeffrey Dunn","username":"TechMaster","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/techmaster/{size}/182893_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-21T21:36:51.842Z","cooked":"

I would make sure your limelight is wired correctly. Per the limelight (linked below). The limelight shouldn’t be connected to the rio. The ethernet should run to the radio or network switch and the power should be run to pdp. Once it’s wired like this it should show up on the limelight finder when the computer is connected to the robot radio.

Limelight for FRC

Quickstart

See the documentation for more details and options.  Mounting: Use four 10-32 screws of 1 1/4" length and four nylock nuts to mount your limelight. Wiring: Run two wires from your Limelight to a slot on your PDP, and add a 5A breaker. Finally, run an...
